messages.content: 9-1-1, what's your emergency?
I just shot my wife.
Can you tell me the address?
Yes, but can they come without sirens?
That's fine. What's the address?
Is that a house or an apartment?
A house.
Okay, and what exactly happened?

She just suffered too much. We're out of money, out of gas. She needed her pill refills. She was suffering. We've been through hell, and I couldn't see her suffer anymore. We were being evicted today, and I just knew she wouldn't last another hospital stay, especially with my insurance being canceled.
So she's been sick?
Yes, very sick, many many times.
Okay, is she still breathing? Is she alive?
I'm pretty sure she's not.
Okay.
I'm sitting on the porch. I'll be waiting for them. The firearm is on top of the TV.
Okay. Stay on the line with me.
Okay.
And what's your name?
And what's your phone number there?
Well, we had that canceled. I'm calling you on my cell phone.
Okay. What's that number?
And it was just the two of you there, nobody else?
Nobody else.
And you said you want them to come without sirens?
Yes, but I don't mind.
Okay. She knew that you were going to do this? Did she ask you to?
No.
Okay. Well, what exactly happened? Was she just sitting there?
She's laying down. She's been laying down most of the time.
Okay. So she didn't know that you were coming?
No, I didn't want her to suffer anymore.
Was she sleeping?
Yes.
Okay, well, we're getting deputies on the way to you. Just stay on the phone with me, okay?
Okay, please tell them not to come with the siren.
I understand.
Yes.
Okay, well, they're coming to help. And you said she'd been sick. Did you guys ever talk about her getting better or anything like that? Her treatment?
We tried, we just did everything we could to keep her alive. They said that her liver was shot. She's had so many strokes and seizures, hip implant, neck fusion.
Okay. How long has she been sick?
Years.
Okay.
And the deputy is here.
Did he come without the siren?
The deputy on the motorcycle came without one, but I hear one coming.
Okay, well, I did ask them not to use the sirens. Is the deputy there now?
Yes, the deputy is here.
Okay, let me know once you're with the deputy, okay?
I'm going to stand up until then.
Yes, sir.
Yes.
Yes, sir. I'm on the phone with 911.
Okay, the deputy just asked me to hang up.
Okay, I'll let you go then.
